FuncDef:
The server no-response accounting command configures a device to continue sending accounting packets when the accounting function is configured and a user is authenticated using the local authentication mode after the server does not respond to the user's authentication request.
The undo server no-response accounting command restores the default setting. The server no-response accounting command configures a device to continue sending accounting packets when the accounting function is configured and a user is authenticated using the local authentication mode after the server does not respond to the user's authentication request. The undo server no-response accounting command restores the default setting. By default, when the accounting function is configured, the device does not send accounting packets when the server does not respond to a user's authentication request and the user then is authenticated using local authentication.
